Encoding¶

Messages¶

Base projector patterns or messages

quanta_SL.encode.message.message_to_inverse_permuation(message_ll, **packbits_kwargs)¶

Convert message LUT inverse to packed integers. Useful to define a mapping between code and binary listing (np.arange).

Parameters

message_ll – message LUT

Returns

integer array

quanta_SL.encode.message.message_to_permuation(message_ll, **packbits_kwargs)¶

Convert message LUT to packed integers. Useful to define a mapping between binary and the code.

Parameters

message_ll – message LUT

Returns

integer array

GrayCodes¶

Long run Gray Codes

“Gray Codes with Optimized Run Lengths”, Goddyn et al. 1998.

Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30519621/generating-long-run-gray-codes

Source: https://sciyoshi.com/2010/12/gray-codes/

Strategies¶

code LUT for various strategies

quanta_SL.encode.strategies.bch_code_LUT(bch_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.BCH, message_bits: int, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, **kwargs) → nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]¶

BCH code LUT.

Parameters

  • bch_tuple – BCH code [n,k,t] parameters

  • message_bits – message dimension

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [2^message_bits] -> F_2^message_bits

:return Code Look-Up Table

quanta_SL.encode.strategies.gray_stripe_code_LUT(gray_message_bits: int, message_bits: int, overlap_bits: int = 1, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, **kwargs)¶

Gray Code (conventional / long run / variants) + stripe scan.

Parameters

  • gray_message_bits – message bits (from MSB) encoded by Gray

  • message_bits – message dimension

  • overlap_bits – message bits encoded by both BCH and stripe

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [2^message_bits] -> F_2^message_bits

:return Code Look-Up Table

quanta_SL.encode.strategies.hybrid_code_LUT(bch_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.BCH, bch_message_bits: int, message_bits: int, overlap_bits: int = 1, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, **kwargs)¶

Hybrid code LUT (BCH + stripe scanning).

Parameters

  • bch_tuple – BCH code [n,k,t] parameters

  • bch_message_bits – message bits (from MSB) encoded by BCH

  • message_bits – message dimension

  • overlap_bits – message bits encoded by both BCH and stripe

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [2^message_bits] -> F_2^message_bits

:return Code Look-Up Table

quanta_SL.encode.strategies.repetition_code_LUT(repetition_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.Repetition, message_bits: int = 0, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, **kwargs) → nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]¶

Repetition code LUT.

Parameters

  • repetition_tuple – Repetition code [n,k] parameters

  • message_bits – message dimension

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [2^message_bits] -> F_2^message_bits

:return Code Look-Up Table

Precision Bits¶

Compare precision frame encoding and decoding

quanta_SL.encode.precision_bits.circular_shifted_stripes(stripe_width: int = 8) → nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int]¶

Generate circularly shifted stripe pattern

Parameters

stripe_width – width of 1’s / 0’s Periodicity is 2 * stripe_width

Returns

code Look Up Table (LUT), columns x time

Generating Projector Patterns¶

quanta_SL.encode.generate_projector_patterns.bch_to_projector_frames(bch_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.BCH, projector_resolution: Tuple[int, int], message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, encoded_dim: Union[int, str] = 'columns', use_complementary: bool = False, show: bool = False, save: bool = False, out_dir: str = '', include_all_white: bool = False)¶

Convert BCH codes to projector frames.

Parameters

  • bch_tuple – BCH code [n,k,t] parameters

  • projector_resolution – width x height

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [num_cols] -> F_2^k

  • encoded_dim – Whether to encode rows or columns

  • use_complementary – whether to save / show complementary (1-frame_i)

  • show – Plot in pyplot

  • save – Save as png

  • out_dir – Folder name to save to

  • include_all_white – Include an all-white frame

quanta_SL.encode.generate_projector_patterns.code_LUT_to_projector_frames(code_LUT: nptyping.types._ndarray.NDArray[None, nptyping.types._number.Int], projector_resolution: Tuple[int, int], encoded_dim: Union[int, str] = 'columns', use_complementary: bool = False, show: bool = False, save: bool = False, out_dir: str = '', include_all_white: bool = False, **unused_kwargs)¶

Generate projector frames from an arbitrary code

Parameters

  • code_LUT – Describes F_2^k o F_2^n code

  • projector_resolution – width x height

  • encoded_dim – Whether to encode rows or columns

  • use_complementary – whether to save / show complementary (1-frame_i)

  • show – Plot in pyplot

  • save – Save as png

  • out_dir – Folder name to save to

  • include_all_white – Include an all-white frame

quanta_SL.encode.generate_projector_patterns.gray_code_to_projector_frames(projector_resolution: Tuple[int, int], encoded_dim: Union[int, str] = 'columns', use_complementary: bool = False, show: bool = False, save: bool = False, out_dir: str = '', include_all_white: bool = False)¶

Gray codes to projector frames

  • projector_resolution – width x height

  • encoded_dim – Whether to encode rows or columns

  • use_complementary – whether to save / show complementary (1-frame_i)

  • show – Plot in pyplot

  • save – Save as png

  • out_dir – Folder to save to

  • include_all_white – Include an all-white frame

quanta_SL.encode.generate_projector_patterns.gray_stripe_to_projector_frames(gray_message_bits: int, projector_resolution: Tuple[int, int], overlap_bits: int = 1, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, encoded_dim: Union[int, str] = 'columns', use_complementary: bool = False, show: bool = False, save: bool = False, out_dir: str = '', include_all_white: bool = False)¶

Generate projector frames for (Gray + stripe scan) strategy

  • projector_resolution – width x height

  • overlap_bits – message bits encoded by both BCH and stripe

  • message_mapping – Describes message m: [num_cols] -> F_2^k

  • encoded_dim – Whether to encode rows or columns

  • use_complementary – whether to save / show complementary (1-frame_i)

  • show – Plot in pyplot

  • save – Save as png

  • out_dir – Folder name to save to

  • include_all_white – Include an all-white frame

quanta_SL.encode.generate_projector_patterns.hybrid_to_projector_frames(bch_tuple: quanta_SL.encode.metaclass.BCH, bch_message_bits: int, projector_resolution: Tuple[int, int], overlap_bits: int = 1, message_mapping: Callable = <function gray_message>, encoded_dim: Union[int, str] = 'columns', use_complementary: bool = False, show: bool = False, save: bool = False, out_dir: str = '', include_all_white: bool = False)¶

  • show – Plot in pyplot

  • save – Save as png

  • out_dir – Folder name to save to

  • include_all_white – Include an all-white frame
